page.title: 02Transport
page.content: In our area there is only one main road,the A914,connecting Dundee and Kirkcaldy with lots of B roads adjoining it.Because of the very small population the service bus only passes twice a day on Tuesdays,Thursdays and Saturdays and therefore most people have cars.Cars are used as the B roads are very hilly and the A road is very busy and therefore not suitable for bikes.Children in this area are taken to and from school by contract buses.Our school has one mini-bus hired by the region which brings us all to school but bigger buses also come down the A914 taking children to the senior school,Bell-Baxter,in Cupar.Apart from the service buses you can also get to town with the post bus which doesn't run on Sundays and public holidays.This service can only take few people as space is limited.
